content: How can I help you today?
I've just been so stressed and can't seem to sleep at night. Work has been overwhelming, and I’m worried I’ll lose my job. It’s hard to shake these thoughts, and I don’t know what to do.

That sounds like a really heavy load to carry. Stress from work and fears about job security can make it tough to focus on anything else, and not being able to sleep just adds to the weight of it all. It’s understandable that you’re feeling this way. Would you like to share more about what’s been going on or how this has been affecting you?

I just can’t seem to turn my brain off at night. The second I lie down, all these worries about work and providing for my family start racing through my mind. I’ll grab my phone to distract myself, but it only seems to make it worse. I just feel stuck.

It sounds like you're really stuck in a cycle where worries are taking over, especially at night when everything is quiet and your mind is racing. Using your phone might feel like a temporary escape, but it seems like it adds to your frustration instead of helping. It’s hard to balance everything, especially when you’re trying to provide for your family while dealing with constant stress. What do you think you need right now to start feeling unstuck or to find a little relief?

I'm not really sure what I need. I just want to be able to sleep and not feel so overwhelmed all the time. Maybe if I had some way to calm my mind at night, it would help, but I don’t even know where to start.

Wanting relief and calm at night makes complete sense, especially with everything on your mind. It sounds like you're open to exploring ways to ease the overwhelm and settle your thoughts. That’s a really important step. What do you think has worked for you in the past to relax or find peace, even if for a moment?

I'm honestly not sure if anything has worked before. It feels like the stress is always there, especially at night. Maybe I've just been too caught up in everything to even try. I guess I’ve never really thought about what could help.

It sounds like the stress has been a constant presence, making it tough to even consider what might help or give you some relief. That’s understandable—it’s hard to see a way forward when the weight of everything feels so overwhelming. By sharing all of this, you’ve already started reflecting on what you want, which is an important step. What would it mean for you if you could find something to bring a little calm into your nights?

It would mean a lot, honestly. Maybe I wouldn’t feel so stuck and could actually wake up with the energy to face everything going on. It’d feel like finally catching a break, even if it’s small. But to be real with you, I don’t know if I even believe I can get to that point.

It’s understandable that it feels hard to believe change is possible when stress has felt so constant—it can make it tough to imagine life being any different. But even acknowledging what it would mean to feel more rested and have energy is an important realization. It shows that deep down, you value your well-being and want to feel ready to face life’s challenges. What do you think it would take for you to start believing that things could improve, even just a little?

Maybe if I could see even a small change, like falling asleep a bit faster or feeling less exhausted during the day, I’d start to believe it’s possible. Right now, I don’t see the way forward, but I think if something actually worked, that could give me some hope. But it’s hard to know what to try.

It makes sense that seeing even a small step forward—like better sleep or feeling less drained—could help you build that sense of hope. Sometimes, it’s those smaller changes that pave the way for bigger shifts over time. It sounds like you’re ready to explore what might work for you, even though it feels uncertain right now. Is there anything else you’d like to talk about before thinking about some ways to move toward those changes?
I think I am okay to end the conversation. Thank you for speaking about this with me.
